Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav's stunning half-century led IND to T20 World Cup 2024 Super 8 stage
Arshdeep Singh's 4-wicket spell saved India's first game against United States
Rishabh Pant and Suryakumar Yadav built a partnership to slowly take India towards the 111-run target
Virat Kohli was dismissed on the second ball of the game
Rohit Sharma was out, and Saurabh Netravalkar is on fire as he dismissed India's strongest batting duo
India defeated United States by 7 wickets to enter the Super 8 round of T20 World Cup 2024
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma won the crucial toss at the New York stadium and chose to bowl first
USA captain Aaron Jones also wanted to bowl first, but now the co-hosts will be put to bat against the mighty Indians
India's probable playing XI: Rohit Sharma (c), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj
USA probable playing XI: Steven Taylor, Monank Patel (c & wk), Andries Gous, Aaron Jones, Nitish Kumar, Corey Anderson, Harmeet Singh, Jasdeep Singh, Nosthush Kenjige, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ali Khan
Post-Match Reflections: India defeated United States by 7 wickets to enter the Super 8 round of T20 World Cup 2024
Suryakumar Yadav's half-century and his brilliant partnership with Shivam Dube propelled India to the Super 8 stage of T20 World Cup 2024
Arshdeep Singh's wonderful spell today as he clinched 4 wickets and conceded just 9 runs in his four over spell
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sport of cricket is as foreign to most Americans as driving on the left-hand side of the road or drinking warm beer
The U.S. national cricket team — which dates to at least 1844 — has already made a dent in the hierarchy of the game by beating Pakistan last week at the Twenty20 World Cup
India and the United States of America will meet on June 12 at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York
The India vs United States T20I match on June 12 will start at 8 PM (India time)
Others: India's bowling coach Paras Mhambrey said that the team management was confident about Hardik Pandya delivering for the team in the ongoing T20 World Cup
As per Google, there is 91 percent chance that India would win today's match
Sanjay Manjrekar spoke on Virat Kohli's problem and said that the old Virat Kohli would have been much better given the pitches
